title.rendered: “Mom, I need a favor”, this is how the new scam begins through WhatsApp

content.rendered:
“Mom, this is my new number, my other mobile has broken and I need a favor”, with this message the new scam that is taking place through WhatsApp. The Police have warned about this new fraudulent use in which the promoters of the scam get in touch with women whom they They ask for money pretending to be their children.

In the message, the scammers indicate to the possible victims that this is their new contact number, but to avoid being discovered they assure them that they cannot receive calls. Then the false sons ask him for money: “Can you make me a transfer to pay for something, since I don’t have the card at hand?” If the victim believes the message, the scammer indicates in detail an account number in which the woman deposits the money she has requested. Once in this step it is impossible to recover this amount since the transfer cannot be stopped, even if the mothers quickly manage to talk to their real children.

In recent weeks, the Police have detected scams of this type in different areas of the country. Its authors have achieved defraud amounts ranging between 2,000 and 26,000 euros. In case of receiving messages of this type, the agents recommend not to lose your temper and make sure that a family member is on the other end of the mobile phone before making payments.
